critique: This document designates Vietnam and adjacent waters as a combat zone for tax purposes, retroactive to January 1, 1964. It's a technical designation related to the Internal Revenue Code. There's no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration policy, executive power expansion, federalism implications, or social inclusion. It has a slight impact on national security vs. civil liberties by providing tax benefits to armed forces in a combat zone, and no impact on economic regulation.
